item.title: Kqueen help
item.dc:creator: @joeyjoe9876 joeyjoe9876
item.description:
@joeyjoe9876 wrote:

ahh i figured out why they were not spawning doh

i don’t like to (like anyone does) but what if i added a timer in the process method?

anyways… i made a command and i killed it the first time, then i did the command again and the second form was there ^^.

im gonna make a timer so you dont have to do the command each time lol[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 01, 2009, 03:47:52 pm[/size][hr]ok the timer worked uploading a vid to youtube…

public void SpawnKalph() { if(queen == 1) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(1158, 3483, 9490, heightLevel); } if(queen == 2) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(1160, 3483, 9490, heightLevel); queen == 1; } }[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 01, 2009, 09:02:39 pm[/size][hr]I think it’s that.

item.title: Kqueen help
item.dc:creator: @joeyjoe9876 joeyjoe9876
item.description:
@joeyjoe9876 wrote:

ok so basicaly i turned normal old kalphite queen into somewhat of a minigame, but im having one problem

i made this method to handle which npcs spawn and when (1158 being kalphite queen (first form) and 1160 kalphite queen 2nd form) and i added the queen thing to the saving method, but when i kill it for the first time it doesnt spawn the second form of kq, can anyone help?

public void SpawnKalph() { if(queen == 1) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(1158, 3483, 9490, heightLevel); } if(queen == 2) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(1160, 3483, 9490, heightLevel); } }

here is what i added in NPCHandler to make the count go up each time 1158 is killed:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1158) { int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling; client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player]; if(ppl.IsInkalphqueen()) { ppl.queen++; }

Read full topic
